data.title: Packed
data.text: The layout of the bar is small and narrow, makes it hard to have a conversation with your group. Fun place but loud, drinks were good, service was overwhelmed.

data.title: Happy Hour stop
data.text: Small narrow bar with great happy hour deals. All drinks are half price which is great deal considering their normal cost. Good selection of liquor and high end drinks. Usually not a problem getting a seat during the week at happy hour. Only downfall is they don't serve food so we had to go next door to Scene Ultra Lounge to eat which is also a good spot.

data.title: Different
data.text: The super cool walled patio out back keeps this bar ahead of its local competitors.  The front room is always packed and there is always a line on the weekend.

data.title: Great happy hour!
data.text: A must do before seeing a show across the street. Great happy hour specials. This is a small but beautiful bar in a great location !

data.title: 2 Martinis
data.text: Awesome atmosphere, cool urban patio, great bartender who can pour a serious cocktail.  A great find for a weary traveler.

data.title: Why does this place exist?
data.text: Stopped by here around midnight on a recommendation.  Need to find that person and slap them around a bit.  Too loud to have a conversation, too cramped to dance...too cramped to walk.  The designer of this space needs to be slapped around a bit as well.  There is another bar are in the back, which has huge potential...there was nothing going on in here at all.  Bartender was nice enough, but the drinks were below average with a way above average price.  Go to Rock Bottom instead.

data.title: Great place!
data.text: Upon first glance I thought this place was having an identity crisis.  Glam/hipster bar playing techno with no dance floor.  We then realized there was a second bar in the back that allowed smoking!  I don't smoke, but on rare occasions, but I enjoy being in dark, smoky bars sometimes.  There was plenty of space to dance, and plenty of couches you could sit on that wasn't bottle service only.  Security frequently came by to make sure people weren't laying on the couches, which I thought was great and kept the place classy, while still having that dark, smoky vibe which I love.  Great place!  Would definitely return!

data.title: Best happy hour and service!
data.text: Best happy hour in the city.  Fantastic drink options for anyone. Options from bourbon, vodka, champagne and beer.  Jenny is the best bartender in the city, the team goes above and beyond to make sure your have a great time! Never a long wait for a drink. The team is very attentive and makes sure everyone is having a great time!  Citrus sun is my favorite, never feel the alcohol until its too late! Monday thru Sunday type of place especially the 4-8 happy hour!

data.title: Great value In an intimate setting.
data.text: Not too many seats bet pretty good drink selection. Bartender was not very appreciative of a good tip. Overall will go back.

data.title: Happy Hour specials
data.text: Like most other reviewers we caught the 4:00 - 8:00 happy hour with all drinks half off and glad we did! All top shelf liquors on special and even on a Saturday night! Ketel vodka drinks for $4 works for me and service was very quick. The interior while narrow is very nice and has upscale feel to it. Nice place to drink but no food at all. I think the back room was some big inside smoking area. Recommend happy hour here but didn't get to see what it's like later.

data.title: Horrendous layout and pitiful environment
data.text:
My group stopped by the Righteous Room last night for a final round of drinks and found the place to be extremely disappointing.  All the previous TripAdvisor reviews talked about Happy Hour so our 1am experience is only representing the late-night scene at the Righteous Room.

The interior of this long & skinny bar is actually decorated quite well with a red ceiling and a nice-looking bartop.  However, there is only a 3-foot walkway between the bar stools and the booths on the opposite side.  So it is almost impossible to navigate this place as there was a good size crowd near the bar trying to fight for a position to order drinks.

In addition, the music in this place was VERY loud.  When I looked around the place, all I saw were people taking gratuitous selfies or texting friends.  It was depressing to see that no real social interaction was taking place inside the Righteous Room.  We walked out without ordering any drinks.

Happy Hour at this place may be a totally different and a much better experience.  But my friends and I will not return to the RR.

data.title: righteous room not so righteous!
data.text:
The decor is lovely , semi- dark  good mood.. the Happy hour is awesome!! 1/2 price drinks till
8pm!....Had 3 beers and would have stayed longer if the bartenders actually would make some kind a conversation with us besides one words answers.... I'm not sure why people  who are NOT people persons get into the SERVICE business????

data.title: Dont let the word get out. Best Happy Hour in town
data.text: I almost dont want to give this review because its my secret getaway. This place has the best happy hour in town. Half off drinks from 4 -8. I bought a round of drinks for 13.00. Wonderful atmosphere. It seems like this is a hideaway but its right across from the Aronoff. Great place to go before hanging out but they have no food. You can bring in food if you want.

data.title: Top Happy Hour in Cincinnati
data.text: Everything 1/2 off from 4-8pm! That means pints of Guisness are $2.50.  They have 6-8 taps - IPAs, ales, et.  Huge bottle selection.  Very cool, laid-back vibe.  They do not serve food, but you can always get it next door at Scene.

data.title: Cool atmosphere, amazing happy hour!
data.text: We were in Cincinnati for a wedding last June and luckily happened to wander into this bar.  Incredibly cool vibe, nice energy level mid-to-late afternoon, awesome cocktail list and half price during happy hour!  If you walk through the bar to the back, you'll find an open-air courtyard! Great all-around!

data.title: Happy Hour is Indeed Most Righteous!
data.text:
I have to admit that my exposure to The Righteous Room is rather limited. I have not been there during the times that others describe as a “mad crush”, when the younger and prettier crowd come out to haunt the downtown bars. My experiences have been all pre-theatre, partaking of the Happy Hour specials before heading across the street to the Aronoff for an evening of theatrical entertainment. So, with that in mind….

It’s shotgun style – narrow with a dark bar on the right, and a group of tables in front, back and along the left wall. During Happy Hour, which runs from 4:00 until 8:00, Monday through Friday, all drinks are half off. Not just some, but all of them. That means a pint of Guinness Draft is only around $2.50 or so. For any bar, that’s amazing. For a downtown bar, that’s incredible. Consume Guinness at home and it’s almost $2.00 per pint. 

They don’t serve food, but that’s really not a problem being downtown and within walking distance to most anything you would want. Their draft and craft beer list is pretty impressive, and there is always something new to try. The spirits selection is good, too, with lots of top and mid-shelf liquors to choose from. The specialty drinks are pretty standard, but, from what I’ve seen, and by sitting at the bar, I can tell you the bartenders are not shy when it comes to the pour.

The atmosphere itself is dark, dim, romantic, and often a little loud. It’s the “sleeve rolled up, tie loosened” type of crowd that permeate the downtown bars after work.  It’s not intimidating for anyone, young or old, although it trends towards the 20-somethings. During Happy Hour, there are Plenty of “after work” groups there, and by 8:00, many of them have been sipping (or guzzling) their adult beverages for hours. I’ve yet to see anyone loud or obnoxious, even when it has been pretty crowded. The bar staff, both male and female, often look like they are ready to leap into a photo shoot of Cincinnati’s Hottest Servers at any moment. I have yet to see an unattractive server working the wood.
Overall, they seem to be pretty knowledgeable, a problem one often sees when dealing with younger staff. 

While you are there, be sure to check out the back bar. It is pretty impressive. Some very beautiful glass and light in that magnificent piece. This place looks like it goes back a ways, and it’s an interesting part of the local downtown history. So if you’re looking for someplace to drink on the cheap after your workday, before the show, or if you just wish to mingle with the pretty people, this may be the place to go.
